rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0001
rows.name:
Hey, Tora... The place where this
Umon guy lives isn't affected by the
Cloud Sea tides, is it?

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0003
rows.name:
Well, I noticed the Cloud Sea's been
pretty low ever since we went off to
save Nia. It's still low now, right?

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0004
rows.name:
I was worrying that depending on
the situation, we might be forced
to find a different route.

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0005
rows.name:
Rex has a point. The Cloud Sea tides
can have a marked effect on the areas
you are able to traverse.

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0006
rows.name:
Sometimes the Cloud Sea may allow
you to swim to places that were once
out of reach...

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0007
rows.name:
But equally it can submerge previously
reachable areas, halting your progress.

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0008
rows.name:
Exactly. So I was wondering whether
we need to worry about any of that
where we're going now.

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0010
rows.name:
But is no problem.
Path to shipyard of Umon not
affected by Cloud Sea at all!

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0012
rows.name:
If it was somewhere we could only
reach at high tide, we'd have to rest
up somewhere until the clouds rise.

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0013
rows.name: That doesn't sound so bad to me.

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0014
rows.name:
Frankly, I'd welcome a well-earned
rest at an inn while we wait for the
tide to change.

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0015
rows.name:
No offense, Rex, but your helmet isn't
always the most comfortable abode!

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0016
rows.name:
Yes, yes...you can always have a
stretch and a lie down next time we
visit the inn at Trigo.

rows.label: fev03_030_125_msg0017
rows.name:
For now though, we go to
shipyard of Umon!
